plant_translocations.content: Acid-delinted cottonseeds were treated with 0.5% (w/w) [35S]- or [N-Me-14C] thiofanox (P), 3,3-dimethyl-1(methylthio)-2-butanone [(methylamino)carbonyl]oxime, before planting. This insecticide was readily taken up by the young seedlings and translocated to the cotyledons and developing leaves where it was rapidly metabolized to its sulfoxide (P1), 3,3-dimethyl-1-(methylsulfinyl)-2-butanone [(methylamino)carbonyl]oxime. The level of P1 declined in the cotton leaves with time, resulting in the formation of the sulfone (P2), 3,3-dimethyl-1-(methylsulfonyl)-2-butanone [(methylamino)carbonyl]oxime, and water-soluble metabolites. Cottonseeds from laboratory and field plants grown from thiofanox-treated seeds contained less than 5 ppb of carbamate residues.
plant_translocations.reference: Holm, R. E., Chin, W. T., Wagner, D. H., & Stallard, D. E. (1975). Metabolism of thiofanox in cotton plants. Journal of Agricultural and Food Chemistry, 23(6), 1056-1060.

method.Test Plant: Cotton (Gossypium hirsutum L. var. Stoneville 213) seeds
method.Plant Grown Condition: Cotton seeds weighing 100 mg each were treated with 500 μg of [35S]P or [N-Me-14C]P in 10 ml of benzene, amounting to 0.5% P by seed weight. Four treated seeds were planted 2.54 cm deep in sterilized greenhouse potting soil contained in 22.9 cm diameter styrofoam pots. The test was replicated 25 times. After 4 weeks, the seedlings were thinned to one per pot. The plants were grown in an environmental growth chamber with 14-hour 30°C day and 10-hour 21°C night temperatures under a mixture of fluorescent and incandescent lamps yielding 43,200 lx at the top of the plants.
method.Chemical Preparation: Labeled chemicals [35S]P, [N-Me-14C]P, and nonlabeled oximes O, O1, and O2 were used. The radioactive and nonradioactive compounds were greater than 99% pure as shown by thin-layer chromatography (TLC).
method.Pesticide Application Details for the Pl: 500 μg of [35S]P or [N-Me-14C]P in 10 ml of benzene was applied to 100 mg cotton seeds, resulting in 0.5% P treatment by seed weight.
method.Other Information: The test was replicated 25 times. Plants were harvested after various periods of radioisotope exposure and stages of development.
